I carried a burden that too long did linger; and sending it home, well, that cost me a finger. Who am I?
This thing that I stole, I had not a clue... what its true nature was, but then neither did you! What was it?
Lost in the dark as the centuries passed, I prefer a wriggling, scaly repast. Who am I?
Come into my parlor, and please don't be rude! For Frodo and Sam will one day, meet my brood. Who am I?
I'm his right hand, his protector, his cook... I'm simpler than Merry, and stronger than Took. Who am I?
I'm braver than smart, though I had to get there. I'm the fool whose mistakes poor Gandalf had to bear. Who am I
I'm smarter than you'd ever tell at one look, even if my best of friends is a fool of a Took. Who am I?
I protected the hobbits though my cost was quite dear; my sword took down foes as my horn sounded clear. Who am I?
I started out dingy and ended up bright; it didn't take bleach to turn gray into white. Who am I?
My eyes, sharper than any blade in the land; but it's arrows I choose to drop foes where they stand. Who am I?
As a young boy I grew up as an elf, though now I must stand and proclaim my true self. Who am I?
I'm fierce and I'm sturdy, and sure of my self. I joined up to keep a close eye on that elf. Who am I?
They say I'm a witch but I'm Nenya's best friend. I see many paths but don't know which is the end. Who am I?
